comment._content: He seems to have been a hot-air balloon racer in the 1910s.

Appreciate the detail of this painting in the larger, original view at: www.flickr.com/photos/paddrick/5723181177/sizes/o/in/phot... Paddy

comment.author: 62438299@N07
comment._content: If you can hold something up and put it down, it is calledweight-lifting; if you can hold something up but can never put it down,it's called burden-bearing. Pitifully, most of people are bearing heavyburdens when they are in love on www.ebayrosettastone.com/

comment.author: 70971773@N07
comment._content:
This is a picture of my maternal grandfather, Myrl Tremelin.  He flew lighter-than-air ships in WWI and helped develop the Goodyear blimp in WWII.  He lived in Akron,Ohio.

diana Roose
Oberlin, Ohio

comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content: He apparently also held the rank of Lieutenant Colonel during the Second World War. Here, he's cited (albeit with his first name misspelled) in The Evening Independent (Massillon, Ohio) of November 7, 1942, at the bottom of Page 7: "Two service men from Akron were the reviewing officers for the band's military review which followed. They were Lieut. Col. Merle D. Tremelin, army air force resident representative at the Goodyear Aircraft Corp., and Lieut. Fred Ongley of the United States navy. . ." See: www.newspaperarchive.com/SiteMap/FreePdfPreview.aspx?img=...

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for finding this information TVL 1970. We'll add some of it to the caption the next time we update the record.

comment.author: 70971773@N07
comment._content:
Myrl David Tremelin lived in Cuyahoga Falls, Ohio.  He served in the Naval Reserves stationed in Pensacola, Florida during World War I (whenthisphoto was taken) and flew hot air balloons for Goodyear.  In World War II, he served as a Lieutenant Colonel in the Army with responsibility for liaison with Goodyear for procurement of rubber goods and other products.  
He was my maternal grandfather and I have care of the Tremelin family history.  happy to provide cites and further details.
Diana Roose, Oberlin, Ohio.   (droose@oberlin.edu)
